label: assump-assumption-regularity-summary
title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
nl_summary: Summary of regularity assumptions (H1)-(H5) ensuring the well-posedness of the coupled mean-field system, satisfied by the Canonical Euclidean Gas, covering domains, potentials, fields, parameters, and functions.

conditions.text: The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ that comprise the phase space {prf:ref}`def-mean-field-phase-space` are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.
The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.
The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.
The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

label: assump-assumption-domain-regularity
title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
nl_summary: The valid position domain X_valid is an open, bounded subset of R^d with C^3 boundary, featuring a C^2 signed distance function in a tubular neighborhood and a unit inward normal vector.

bullet_items.name: Smoothness
bullet_items.text: X_valid is an open, bounded domain with C^3 boundary ∂X_valid.

bullet_items.name: Distance Function
bullet_items.text: The signed distance function d(x) := dist(x, ∂X_valid) is C^2 in a tubular neighborhood T_δ := {x ∈ X_valid : d(x) < δ} for some δ > 0.

bullet_items.name: Unit Inward Normal
bullet_items.text: For each x ∈ T_δ, let n_x(x) = -∇d(x) denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into X_valid).

conditions.text: X_valid is an open, bounded domain with C^3 boundary ∂X_valid.
The signed distance function d(x) := dist(x, ∂X_valid) is C^2 in a tubular neighborhood T_δ := {x ∈ X_valid : d(x) < δ} for some δ > 0.
For each x ∈ T_δ, let n_x(x) = -∇d(x) denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into X_valid).

label: assump-assumption-integrator-regularity
title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
nl_summary: Assumes the discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB update) produces position updates of a specific form, including a quadratic force term and a position remainder.

bullet_items.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

conditions.text: The discrete kinetic integrator produces position updates of the specified form.
conditions.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Force function evaluated at position x.

parameters.name: position remainder
parameters.description: Remainder term in the position update.

label: assump-density-regularity-killing
title: Density Regularity
nl_summary: The phase-space density f^τ at the start of each discrete timestep is bounded in L^∞ and belongs to C^1(Ω) with bounded spatial gradient in L^∞.

parameters.name: density bound constant
parameters.description: Positive upper bound for the L^∞ norm of the phase-space density f^τ.

parameters.name: gradient bound constant
parameters.description: Positive upper bound for the L^∞ norm of the spatial gradient of f^τ.
